attributes.action: Require cases of controlling & coercive behaviour to be heard by trained judges
attributes.background: The standard jury system cannot understand or deal appropriately with perpetrators of psychological abuse. These cases must be exempt from a jury and heard by a judge with specialist psychology level trained to understand narcistic traits of controlling and coercive behaviour in all relationships.
attributes.additional_details: This crime is mind torture as the perpetrator isolates and abuses their victim to the extreme in a calculated way so they are trapped completely. This is not seen by anyone and the evidence is minimal for conviction with a public jury. Perpetrators will not leave their victims alone. They cover up so well and you are made to look crazy. You get Stockholm syndrome, PTSD and ill. However many times you flee, they can find you, they know exactly what they are doing.

attributes.action: Call for government to end the Badger Cull in the United Kingdom
attributes.background: The scientific evidence demonstrates that culling is ineffective in fighting the disease and, worse still, risks making the problem even worse. We believe the emphasis of all our efforts should be to find a long-term solution and we are calling for the Government to end its policy,
attributes.additional_details: The Badger Cull is not only not working to protect Cattle and Dairy Herds but is causing very dangerous situations around the country where hired Marksmen are shooting and sometimes trapping badgers. The real victims are the badgers please sign the petition to stop the cull.

attributes.action: Reinstate the annual Royal Tournament
attributes.background:
The Royal Tournament was the world's largest military tattoo and pageant, held by the British Armed Forces annually between 1880 and 1999.
A celebration of the British Armed Forces, and promoting the UK globally, it is the ideal annual event to promote support for the British Armed Forces.
attributes.additional_details: The Royal Tournament provides many benefits to the UK, showcasing the UK military as well as in terms of services charitable awareness, retention of personnel and as a much needed recruitment tool for our armed services.

attributes.action: Stop NHS sharing data with 3rd-party advertisers, analytics and social media
attributes.background: When you use NHS websites, you get tracked. The issue was raised in 2010 by MPs, but was not resolved. Instead, Facebook and other companies went on to get data for a further 7 years. NHS privacy policies say that there's tracking. Such 3rd parties should be barred from NHS websites and mobile apps.
attributes.additional_details: The combination of HTTP Referers, third party cookies and third party JavaScript, provide these parties with the ability to track users by their unique or user ids and identify pages visited. Furthermore, third party JavaScript allows them to change NHS page content as they see fit, access data on it or act as the user on pages. I've complained directly to the NHS, ICO and Ministers in the hope of getting this fixed, but it is still a serious problem.

attributes.action: Introduce a “DADB1” form alongside the “MATB1” form.
attributes.background: The "DADB1" form is for expectant fathers to hand to their employer to kickstart discussions about, and preparation for, Shared Parental Leave (SPL). Researchers have indicated that increasing the numbers of men taking SPL is likely to be a lever in closing the UK’s gender pay gap.
attributes.additional_details:
SPL was introduced in the UK April 2015. Around 285,000 qualify for SPL every year yet the take-up could be as low as 2% (source: gov.uk). The Government launched a “Share the joy” campaign in February 2018 to promote SPL and increase the uptake. The impact of this is not yet known.

I believe the "DADB1" form is a simple, pragmatic step towards growing the number of men taking SPL by kickstarting early conversations between expectant fathers and their employers.

attributes.action: Create a permit system for  garden fireworks and when they can be used.
attributes.background: I would like to request request the introduction of a permit system for use of fireworks in domestic situations.  A total ban is unfair on the many sensible users, but he affect on animals, domestic and wild, and vulnerable people is now greater than be considered fair.
attributes.additional_details:
The modern "firework season" lasts for a week or more. What constitutes a domestic firework has changed drastically with many being what would previously have been considered display fireworks.  Therefore I would like to request;

1) A permit system for domestic firework displays 

2) Home firework displays limited to certain times  on bonfire weekend & New Year's eve.

3) Stricter controls on fireworks for sale to the general public.

4) Increase legal age for the purchase of fireworks to 25.

attributes.action: Only allow public use of Fireworks on select dates
attributes.background: Almost all animals suffer from the loud bangs from fireworks & can cause them to have health problems. As well as that, fireworks can cause stress to PTSD sufferers & people who generally have a fear of them.
attributes.additional_details: Only allowing public use of fireworks on select dates (for example, Bonfire night, New Years Eve & Chinese New Year) would really help for animals & people who suffer from the fireworks. It would mean they have time to plan & be more calm & on other nights when it’s professional displays only, people will know when the fireworks will go off & when they will stop, so it’s not much of a fright.

attributes.action: Make the nit nurse mandatory in schools to remedy this increasing infection rate
attributes.background: Checking for and treating nits are now the parents responsibility. With the absence of the nit nurse, nits are now rife, especially within primary schools.
attributes.additional_details:
Nits are getting immune to treatments and the removal process is not only traumatising for children with longer hair, its time consuming and expensive. For these reasons, unfortunately, some children go left untreated and the epidemic continues. 

Petitions have been tried before and failed and I can’t understand why. People you speak to, social media posts -nits are a huge problem within our schools. We need to re-instate the nit nurse and once again, get control over this unhygienic, distressing situation.

attributes.action: Offer a catchup HPV vaccine programme to women aged 18-26 on the NHS
attributes.background:
- Many women missed the HPV vaccine while at school due to parental abstention or missed appointments.
- The HPV vaccine is currently only available to women on the NHS up until age 18
- The vaccine retails at £450 at high-street pharmacies - utterly unaffordable for most.
attributes.additional_details:
NHS vaccine guidelines - https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/vaccinations/hpv-human-papillomavirus-vaccine/

3100 cases of cervical cancer are diagnosed in the UK each year - almost ALL are related to HPV - https://www.cancerresearchuk.org/about-cancer/cervical-cancer

It's utterly unacceptable that girls and women who were opted out by their parents while at school are unable to catch up when they hit the age of medical consent. Providing the vaccine as a catchup will save lives, and save NHS money.

attributes.action: Each child receiving high rate DLA should have a ECHP when they turn 3
attributes.background: I thought my son would go to mainstream school, I was wrong. If the EHCP was a procedure that was required to happen, he would not be without a school. Most high rate DLA children cannot cope in a mainstream school. This needs to be in place to give parents the options that’s right for their child.
attributes.additional_details: I have waited 31 weeks and still have no place as I was not given enough guidance. This is a process most will only go through once. Let’s make it easier to get a child into the right school. Inclusion, not exclusion. No mainstream school could cater for my son. Many children are placed in the wrong provisions to make the numbers match. It’s time this changed and this process is looked at.

attributes.action: The UK government should allow Steve Bannon to enter the UK
attributes.background: Steve Bannon is not a far-right political figure he is just plain and simple Right.  To say he poses a risk to the security of the UK is absurd. He should be allowed to enter the UK and give a strong alternative view to the liberal left we have here.

attributes.action: Protect Women. Make IVF Safer. Amend IVF Law.
attributes.background:
At 25, high dosages of IVF drugs led me to have a heart attack. I am not alone. Last year around 3,700 women undergoing IVF suffered from Ovarian Hyper Stimulation Syndrome. 
That’s why I want an explicit commitment to women’s welfare added to the Human Fertilisation & Embryology Act.
attributes.additional_details:
Protecting the welfare of women undergoing IVF treatment is absent in the Human Fertilisation and Embryology Act. Consequently, the Human Fertilisation Embryology Authority (HFEA) is unable to monitor or regulate guidelines on clinical practices relating to the administration of drugs and dosages during IVF. This is why this petition is asking for the Act to be amended. 

Together, let’s make this process safer. Please sign and share this petition with your friends and colleagues. Thank you.

attributes.action: Require UK fashion retailers to sign up to an environmental code of ethics
attributes.background:
Companies trading in the UK should be required to source clothes responsibly.
 
To feed a culture of cheap fashion, companies are ignoring the environmental damage in developing countries.
 
Fashion is the 2nd largest global polluter. The UK is one of the largest consumers of fashion.
attributes.additional_details:
BBC production: Stacey Dooley Investigates Fashion's Dirty Secret. 
https://www.bbc.co.uk/bbcthree/article/5a1a43b5-cbae-4a42-8271-48f53b63bd07

attributes.action: Ban vaping in public places
attributes.background: Not enough is known about vaping and its long-term health effects. The Government shouldn’t allow vaping in public places such as public transport. Let’s protect our children and treat it as a potential health problem of the future.
attributes.additional_details:
This article says that there are potential health issues with vaping and more needs to be learnt. Let’s protect ourselves and future generations now. 
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/amp.theguardian.com/science/2018/jan/29/vaping-may-raise-cancer-and-heart-disease-risk-study-suggests

attributes.action: Ban the sale of over the counter drugs such as paracetamol to children.
attributes.background: It is crazy that children are allowed to purchase over the counter drugs. We urgently need a ban on sales to minors. Children can buy drugs, such as paracetamol, unbeknown to their parents.
attributes.additional_details: Some children are depressed and parents may need to take stringent precautions to keep them away from medication to keep them safe.

attributes.action: To require pharmacies to have Epipens (and other AAIs) in store at all times.
attributes.background: When my son tried his first ever peanut within seconds he began vomiting, coughing and broke out into hives. My son could have died. It is only an epipen that could save his life if ever he was to go into anaphylactic shock. Not having an Epipen readily available in pharmacies is endangering lives.
attributes.additional_details: The problem with an allergy is you never know how serious it is going to be. Sometimes my son may just vomit, or his lips will swell. One day his tongue may swell so much that his airway is blocked so he can’t breath. With an Epipen the adrenaline would act instantly and save my son’s life. If insufficient Epipens (and other AAIs) are being manufactured and stocked my son might not have one to save his life! Please ensure this life saving medicine is readily available in our pharmacies.

attributes.action: Issue 5-year work visa to non-EU nurses and doctors coming to work for the NHS
attributes.background: Issuing a 5-year work visa to non EU nurses & doctors will help staff retention. After 5 years, they can apply for a resident permit & settle in UK. This will encourage nurses & doctors to continue working for their first NHS Trust visa sponsor instead of moving to another Trust or worst leave UK.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/society/2018/jul/26/nhs-in-england-facing-deepening-staffing-crisis-figures-show

http://workpermit.com/immigration/usa/permanent-us-residence-nurses

attributes.action: Bring back the death penalty to reduce crime rates in the UK
attributes.background: We believe that bringing back the death penalty will help to reduce crimes being committed and to create a safer community for us and future generations. Also it will help to get murderers and rapists off the streets to make us less worried when going out or letting our children out.
attributes.additional_details: We have previously created a questionnaire to gather peoples views and opinions on whether we should bring back the death penalty or not. We asked 22 local residents a range of different questions when we got the questionnaires back out of the 22 people asked 55% feel as though it should be brought back too create a safer environment for our future generations where as the other 45% feel as though it shouldn't be brought back because it is not right to commit the "an eye for and eye" because it is too harsh of a punishment and what if they were framed then they loose their life for nothing.

attributes.action: Make Sileby Train station more accessible.
attributes.background: Our community wants better access to Sileby train station so that wheelchair users, individuals who have mobility issues and individuals who have children in pushchairs. There are many steps going up to the platform. Therefore wheelchairs, pushchairs and those who cannot manage steps cannot access.

attributes.action: Tourist visa free access UK for citizens of the republic of Albania.
attributes.background: Since 2010 the citizens of the Albania were granted a Visa-free to the Schengen are countries. We think that the United Kingdom needs to follow the example set from the EU and to allow the Albanians citizens a visa-free entry for tourism purpose in the UK

attributes.action: Enact an Environmental Law
attributes.background: Since the BBC 1 broadcasting of the Blue Planet (Oceans) showing the harm caused to marine life by plastic packaging there has been a public outcry.
attributes.additional_details:
Supermarket chains should be compelled (by law) to publish on their web sites their use of three categories of plastic packaging.

1) Single Use Plastic 
2) Recyclable Plastic 
3) 100% biodegradable plastic 

And all as a percentage of their total plastic packaging. - Doing this would enable consumers to make choices as to where they shop, and what purchases they make not just on price but additionally and importantly on environmental sustainability.

attributes.action: people who are earning less than £50,000 salary should pay 10% tax
attributes.background: People living in the uk are struggling to look after there families and pay there bills. If we work overtime at our jobs the tax is taking more of our money this shouldnt be the case. If you earn less than £50,000 we should pay 10% tax. This is the reason why people are our there breaking the law

attributes.action: Restrict the number of hounds used for trail hunting to two.
attributes.background: The hunting act of 2004 is being abused in the guise of drag hunting, I therefore suggest that the maximum number of hounds used in a drag/trail hunt would be two, as it only takes one dog to follow a trail.

attributes.action: Ensure MPs can scrutinise, amend and vote on any final Brexit deal
attributes.background: The British people voted in the referendum on our membership of the EU and our politicians must organise a coordinated withdrawal in the best interest of the nation. Our democratically elected representatives must not be stripped of the power to analyse and amend any deal before passing it into law.
attributes.additional_details: The future of our nation will be affected profoundly by leaving the EU. Our representatives in Parliament must be able to have a meaningful say and make binding amendments on the terms of the final Brexit proposals made by Government negotiators. To not do so undermines our democracy and silences parliament. A rushed ill considered “take it or leave it” vote would adversely affect our nation for generations.

attributes.action: To prohibit the sale of rat poison to non-professionals
attributes.background: People are baiting dog treats and or leaving large quantities of it in parks and open spaces to kill off animals. I have had one dog recently die and another even more recently digest a large quantity and is lucky to be alive. Luckily we rushed him straight to the vets and he is now home safe.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theargus.co.uk/news/16860293.family-devastated-as-rat-poison-kills-one-dog-and-almost-kills-another/

attributes.action: Bring a proposal to the UN for world multilateral disarmament.
attributes.background: Arms companies spread weapons worldwide that produce wars, destruction, death, poverty and global warming.
attributes.additional_details:
World Disarmament ends this failure; disarmed countries do not fight. It can be done if the military are not in charge of the process - turkeys don't vote for Christmas. It is world transforming.

The proposal to the UN should be that: 
1. Each state cuts military expenditure and arms by 10% a year for a decade. 
2. All arms production and selling stops. Arms firms have 5 year falling state subsidy while they refocus their business. 
3. The UN has a (reducing) armed force to clear out terrorist and other armed groups. 
4. The UN and all nations police these policies with open access to all military systems. 
5. UN Courts decide issues of injustice, infringement of disarmament and international disputes.

attributes.action: Change Government Policy that allows Developers to destroy our Countryside
attributes.background: The current National Planning Framework Policy which dictates the requirements for housing development in the UK means developers have been given the power to force LA's to offer up a minimum of 5 yrs land supply for development putting immense pressure to offer up normally protected Greenbelt
attributes.additional_details: The 5yr land supply makes no allowance for sites that have been given approval but have yet to be developed, ie if the annual requirement for houses in a particular borough, set by government is 1000/yr, the LA must continually find sites to maintain a min. stock of 5000, regardless of whether the developers decide to build or not due to economic or other factors. Developers use this policy to build land stocks while our villages, countryside & greenbelt are being destroyed for profit/greed

attributes.action: Urge USA not to cease funding UNWRA and contribute towards any shortfall
attributes.background:
The US decision further destabilises the Middle East and make the possibility of a peaceful solution more remote. It shows further partiality in favour of Israel following  moving its embassy to Jerusalem and increasing aid to Israel

UK should urge other countries to help making up the shortfall
attributes.additional_details:
UNWRA provides food aid and education to Palestinian refugees and this loss of funding will cause immense suffering and misery.
https://www.unrwa.org
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-45377336

attributes.action: Charge 5p for plastic straws
attributes.background: I believe if we were to introduce a charge for straws, as was done in 2015 for carrier bags, more people would refuse a straw in their drinks. This would drastically reduce the number of single use plastic straws entering our oceans and landfills, therefore positively affect the environment.
attributes.additional_details:
Since 5 October 2015, large retailers in England have been required by law to charge 5p for all single-use plastic carrier bags. This lead to 83% fewer bags being issued, which is equivalent to each person in the population using 25 plastic bags rather than 140 bags a year. 
This shows how the 5p charge on carrier bags had a positive effect on consumer's behaviour. It is estimated that 8.5 billion straws are used in the UK every year. This means potentially 8.5 billion straws are entering our oceans and landfills each year. I believe if we were to introduce a charge for straws, more people would refuse a straw therefore drastically reducing this number and positively affecting the environment.

attributes.action: Raise the age of sale, of fireworks, to the general public from 18 to 25.
attributes.background: All year round this is an issue but it becomes more apparent in the winter months. Irresponsible youths are allowed to purchase fireworks and they have no regard for the safety of others. Fireworks are meant to be fun but in the wrong hands they soon become weapons.
attributes.additional_details: I have already read so many public posts, by people who have already been affected by youths setting off fireworks in public places, about people whose pets suffer huge distress, let alone non domestic wildlife. If fireworks must be sold to the public it needs to be regulated better.

attributes.action: Add medical examinations and re-testing of Drivers over the age of retirement
attributes.background: Unfortunately there is little legislation to ensure the capability and medical standard needed to drive safely is always maintained. People pass their test and later slip into bad habits or develop health implications that prove a risk to others.

attributes.action: Allow European Nationals to vote in UK general elections
attributes.background:
European Nationals are contributing in  all parts of the British society and are currently  not allowed to vote in general elections ,when citizens of the commonwealth are allowed , help us end this unfair practice.
Give them a voice, give them a chance to vote
attributes.additional_details:
European Nationals are your neighbours, your friends, your husbands and wives, many have settled in the UK and are making a real contribution to your daily lives, they serve you in your local cafe, they are your doctors and Nurses .
They love the UK and pay their taxes here, but are currently not allowed to vote in the general elections, we want to ask the UK government to end this unfair practice and allow them to vote in the general elections.

attributes.action: Include teaching ‘self examination’ in health/sex education in schools.
attributes.background: Having been diagnosed with breast cancer ive learnt that early detection really does save lives.How many truly check and know their bodies?In school we are taught sex ed/hygiene. Teaching to routinely self examine the correct way in this lesson would bring body awareness and in turn early detection
attributes.additional_details: My intention with this petition is that if self examination is introduced to the health/sex Education curriculum then self checking would become part of our daily lives and routines like washing/cleaning teeth/wearing deodorant. ..whilst in the shower we check ourselves. Right now we don’t all do it because we weren’t taught too from a young age and it’s not routine. This needs to change and be taught in schools, early detection does save lives it is so important to know your body!

attributes.action:
CELEBRATE BREXIT! 

Make March 29 an annual Bank Holiday
attributes.background:
On March 29 2019, we will be leaving the EU. 
We call upon the Government to mark this historic occasion by making March 29 an annual Bank Holiday. 
Where March 29 falls on a weekend, the Bank Holiday should be held on the nearest Monday. 
.
attributes.additional_details: We believe this is the best way to celebrate the result of the biggest democratic vote in our history

attributes.action: Introduce prostrate screening for men from 55 years of age.
attributes.background: I know a small group of guys where 6 people have been diagnosed with prostrate cancer, sadly one of these recently passed away. Earlier screening could have prevented this death.
attributes.additional_details: Prostrate cancer in men is growing as reported in many media reports. Woman get screened for Breast cancer and with the increase in prostrate cancer earlier screening can save lives and reduce NHS costs.

attributes.action: Require shops to give workers Boxing Day, New Year’s Day and Easter Sunday off.
attributes.background: It’s so unfair. Whilst area managers, company owners and office staff stay home with their families retail workers HAVE to work! We need time at home with our families too. Where I live there is no public transport on Boxing Day so I’m expected to walk the 4 miles to work and back!!

attributes.action: To Make it Mandatory for cinemas to show at least 4 films a week subtitled.
attributes.background: I am a 13 year old boy who is hearing impaired, and fed up with not being able to watch movies like my friends can. I miss out on so many movies. The cinemas only show at best one a week and they are usually at very inconvenient times. Why can’t there be 4 subtitled showings of every movie a week?
attributes.additional_details: I have checked at multiple cinemas, and they have said that you can request for a film to be shown subtitled, however there are no guarantees they will and also they require several weeks notice with no flexibility on times or days, which means I am usually left with their day and time schedule or nothing, which is more often the case. I feel very strongly that this is unfairly discriminating people with a hearing impairment. Given that, most movies are shown around 5 to 10 times a day for 2 or 3 weeks, resulting in at least 105 showings of each film. I don’t feel that it’s too much too ask to have 4 subtitled showings a week.

attributes.action: All schools, by law, should have a Puffin Crossing outside the school gates.
attributes.background: Too many drivers and pedestrians in the UK have either had fatal injuries or died due to road safety. By having Puffin Crossings outside of schools, we can prevent accidents from happening outside of schools. Help us make a difference to driver's and student's experiences when using the roads.
attributes.additional_details: Too many students have sadly passed away after being hit by a car not far from their schools. Sometimes schools campaign to get a Puffin Crossing outside of the gates to prevent injuries from taking place, however they shouldn’t need to. It should be law that a Puffin Crossing is outside the school gates. Myself and two of my peers are starting this petition to not only raise awareness to road safety; we want to make a difference for students in the future.

attributes.action: Legislate to ensure packaging materials of all items are clearly identified.
attributes.background: The UK has various systems of recycling with geographical differences in what is recycled. This is made more difficult as it's not always obvious what an item or packaging is made from. This is particularly important re plastic as some types are recyclable and others not. Clear labelling may assist.
attributes.additional_details:
I have been doing my best for a while now to try and reduce my impact, including reusing and then recycling items to reduce the amount going to landfill. A lot of people do the same and some councils are very good at encouraging this. However I hear a lot of people saying that it is too complicated to recycle as they don't know what goes in which bin, etc. 

If we were to have a standardised system of labelling, with all packaging showing what it is made from it would assist people greatly.

attributes.action: Ban the use of unsustainable palm oil in products sold within the UK
attributes.background: As we are all aware, the exploitation of natural rain-forests is prominent in the production of palm oil. The rainforests of Borneo are thought to be up to 130 million years old and provide a home for around 1,200 animals, of which 100 are endemic.
attributes.additional_details: There is a lot being done by local charities and conservationists but there is little help when multinational corporations can afford to do almost anything they like. We, as British Citizens, must do more to affect the demand for products containing palm oil and stop the degredation of these rainforests. In an ever-conscious world, there is no excuse to be making decisions that affect our planet in such a catastrophic way. We are the cause and we can be solution.

attributes.action: Remove Arriva of their contract for disruptions to people and the economy
attributes.background:
Strip arriva rail north of the franchise as they are not giving customers 100%

We want to the government to strip arriva rail north of the franchise as the company are failing everywhere - trains delayed, they're getting rid of guards.

attributes.action: Have a referendum to devolve Yorkshire into a country.
attributes.background: As a student in the heart of Yorkshire, I believe it is the fundamental right for citizens of Yorkshire to have greater power over their society, economy and environment.
attributes.additional_details: This is why I am proposing to start a referendum to decide whether the people of Yorkshire want to be independent from England but remain in the United Kingdom.

attributes.action: Give EU citizens working in the NHS free indefinite leave to remain in the UK.
attributes.background:
The possibility of a "no-deal" Brexit has been described as uncomfortably high. 
There are a significant number of EU citizens working in the NHS.  Any disruption in their working rights may have catastrophic effects. The government should give them indefinite leave to remain for free.
attributes.additional_details:
There are more than 60,000 NHS staff who are EU citizens. At present, there is no assurance that they can continue working post Brexit. This makes recruitment of staff challenging. 
The suggested £65 fee represents more than one day's earnings for the majority of them and cannot be justified for administration purposes.

attributes.action: Modernise and Amend The Highways Act of 1835
attributes.background: The Highways Act of 1835 is preventing Tech Startups and Global Business specialising in PLEV's (Personal Light Electronic Vehicle) from trading in the UK. It will also increase capacity of our cities by getting people off public transport and having fewer cars on the road.
attributes.additional_details:
Please see... http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/Will4/5-6/50/section/LXXII/enacted

The purpose of this partition is to ask the government to change the law so that PLEV's (Electronic Scooters)can be ridden in public areas. Currently they are banned from both Pavements and Roads. PLEV's are a cost effective environmentally friendly emission free way of getting around a city. PLEV's also need a classification as a vehicle type as a part of this in the same way as Electronic Bikes are classified

attributes.action: Urgent Review & Increased Funding of "The 5 Year Forward View for Mental Health"
attributes.background: We urgently need more specialist psychiatric hospitals, walk in clinics, community psychiatrists and nurses.More Day Centres & facilities for people with mental health issues but to get the service back where it should be, we need the funding, and proper funding, to enable this to happen.
attributes.additional_details:
Approx. 15.5M people suffer with a mental health problem in the UK, which is roughly 1 in 4 people. Current plans need reviewing and funding needs injecting urgently. Awareness, Funding & Resources are quickly needed. Waiting times are excessive and lives are being lost as a result of this terrible dilemma we are in. 

Mental Health cases have have increased, which in turn has lead to an increase in our already stretched Emergency Services to deal with problems more frequently. LET'S TALK

attributes.action: Change Dangerous Dog Act to exclude puppies from being detained under this act
attributes.background: A 4 month old puppy has been detained under the dangerous dog act after escaping from a garden onto a busy main road. Obviously scared and distressed, he hid under a stationary lorry.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst he was being retrieved, he unfortunately bit a police officer.
https://www.thekennelclub.org.uk/getting-a-dog-or-puppy/general-advice-about-caring-for-your-new-puppy-or-dog/toilet-training-for-puppies/puppy-training-biting-nipping/

Puppies are born in the litter, and they play with biting, it takes them a few month to learn about biting. 
A scared dogs normal reaction is to bite to self defend

attributes.action: Release IPP prisoners whose sentence exceeds current sentence guidelines
attributes.background: There are many people still serving an ipp sentence (imprisonment for public protection.) Although the law changed in 2012 to get rid of this sentence as this was classed as inhumane. Many people are still serving this sentence. My partner is currently 1 of 3000 people who are on this sentence.
attributes.additional_details:
These people are serving their time but why should these prisoners have to serve something that was abolished? 
why should the prison system have one sentence for one and another for someone else who did the same crime but a few years later? 
I am proposing that parliament brings the ipp sentence inline with the sentence that was brought in to replace it. 
This will help address the over crowding.
 
In 2017 there were still 3,350 IPPs still in prison. 
http://ippfanilycampaign.blogspot.com/

attributes.action: Don't agree this terrible EU deal that gives us no benefits.
attributes.background:
The Withdrawal Agreement is horrendous. 
 
We'd have to pay £39 billion to the EU just to leave. That's £39 billion that could be going to nurses, police officers and teachers.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK will have no right to unilaterally leave the customs arrangement. This is simply unacceptable. It's a shoddy Brexit.
 
Quite frankly, we need a better deal. One that doesn't charge us £39 billion to leave the EU. We shouldn't have to pay that much to leave an organization we've been part of for over 30 years. This is extortion.

attributes.action: Prevent government from including gagging clauses in contracts with charities.
attributes.background: The government has reportedly included clauses in their contracts with NGOs, charities and businesses, barring the organisations in question from creating 'adverse publicity'. This prevents organisations speaking up for the people they are trying to help. Sign the petition to have this debated.
attributes.additional_details:
This type of gagging clause has been reported to have been used with Brexit consultants, Grenfell Tower investigators and charities working with Universal Credit claimants, amongst others. 
 
The government is systematically silencing dissent, putting self interest above the welfare of its citizens. This, ultimately, represents a threat to democracy.
 
Sign the petition so this can be discussed in Parliament.

attributes.action: Ban all non-recyclable plastic within 5 years
attributes.background: Every year in the UK we buy around 3.7 million tonnes of plastic as packaging, with only 842,000 tonnes being recycled. We as the UKs consumers find this to be unacceptable for the environment and the future of the planet.
attributes.additional_details: The government has a very complicated 25 year plan to eliminate plastic waste but they could pass a law to ban these products in our shops within 5 years or sooner. Our current government is largely sponsored by big businesses and won’t want to cause them the bother of producing alternatives which won’t destroy our precious world. However, as we elect and pay for these people to represent our wishes it is time we demanded what we want for our children’s future.
